titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jack Durham papers, 1850-1985 MS2053
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-18 14:24:52 -0400.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Jack Durham papers
did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, videocassette, slides, articles from various publications, and several artifacts, related to the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal. The material covers the years 1950-75. This correspondence is between Mr. Durham had his friends and associates as they worked to protect and preserve the C & O Canal.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Jack Durham papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: During his lifetime, C.J. S. (Jack) Durham (d. 1991), was extremely active in the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal Association. He worked very hard for the passage on January 8, 1971 of Public Law 91-644 authorizing the establishment of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park. At his funeral, Colin Ritter described Durham as " . . . a Renaissance Man--a journalist, poet, artist, philosopher, raconteur, and battler for the wilderness"

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, videocassette, slides, articles from various publications, and several artifacts, related to the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal. The material covers the years 1950-75. This correspondence is between Mr. Durham had his friends and associates as they worked to protect and preserve the C & O Canal. There is also material related to Rock Creek Park Day. Durham served as Chair of the steering committee for the creation of this event.

controlaccess.geogname: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal (Md. and Washington, D.C.)
Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
controlaccess.subject: Canals
